param.name: SERVO9_MIN
param.documentation: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO9_MAX
param.documentation: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO9_TRIM
param.documentation: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO9_REVERSED
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

param.name: SERVO9_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: SERVO_BLH_MASK
param.documentation: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

param.humanName: BLHeli pass-thru auto-enable for multicopter motors
param.name: SERVO_BLH_AUTO
param.documentation: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TEST
param.documentation: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TMOUT
param.documentation: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TRATE
param.documentation: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

param.name: SERVO_BLH_DEBUG
param.documentation: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_OTYPE
param.documentation: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_PORT
param.documentation: This sets the mavlink channel to use for blheli pass-thru. The channel number is determined by the number of serial ports configured to use mavlink. So 0 is always the console, 1 is the next serial port using mavlink, 2 the next after that and so on.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_POLES
param.documentation: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_3DMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

param.humanName: BLHeli bitmask of bi-directional dshot channels
param.name: SERVO_BLH_BDMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_RVMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs in reversed mode

param.name: SERVO_FTW_MASK
param.documentation: Servo channel mask specifying FETtec ESC output.

param.name: SERVO_FTW_RVMASK
param.documentation: Servo channel mask to reverse rotation of FETtec ESC outputs.

param.name: SERVO_FTW_POLES
param.documentation: Number of motor electrical poles

param.name: SERVO_ROB_POSMIN
param.documentation: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

param.name: SERVO_ROB_POSMAX
param.documentation: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

param.name: SERVO_SBUS_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

param.name: SERVO_VOLZ_MASK
param.documentation: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

param.name: SPRAY_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the sprayer

param.name: SPRAY_PUMP_RATE
param.documentation: Desired pump speed when traveling 1m/s expressed as a percentage

param.name: SPRAY_SPINNER
param.documentation: Spinner's rotation speed in PWM (a higher rate will disperse the spray over a wider area horizontally)

param.name: SPRAY_SPEED_MIN
param.documentation: Speed minimum at which we will begin spraying

param.name: SPRAY_PUMP_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum pump speed expressed as a percentage

param.name: SRTL_ACCURACY
param.documentation: SmartRTL accuracy. The minimum distance between points.

param.humanName: SmartRTL maximum number of points on path
param.name: SRTL_POINTS
param.documentation: SmartRTL maximum number of points on path. Set to 0 to disable SmartRTL. 100 points consumes about 3k of memory.

param.name: SRTL_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of SmartRTL options.

param.name: STAT_BOOTCNT
param.documentation: Number of times board has been booted

param.name: STAT_FLTTIME
param.documentation: Total FlightTime (seconds)

param.name: STAT_RUNTIME
param.documentation: Total time autopilot has run

param.name: STAT_RESET
param.documentation: Seconds since January 1st 2016 (Unix epoch+1451606400) since statistics reset (set to 0 to reset statistics)

param.name: TRQD_TYPE
param.documentation: Torqeedo connection type

param.name: TRQD_ONOFF_PIN
param.documentation: Pin number connected to Torqeedo's on/off pin. -1 to use serial port's RTS pin if available

param.name: TRQD_DE_PIN
param.documentation: Pin number connected to RS485 to Serial converter's DE pin. -1 to use serial port's CTS pin if available

param.name: TRQD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Torqeedo Options Bitmask

param.name: TRQD_POWER
param.documentation: Torqeedo motor power. Only applied when using motor connection type (e.g. TRQD_TYPE=2)

param.name: TRQD_SLEW_TIME
param.documentation: Torqeedo slew rate specified as the minimum number of seconds required to increase the throttle from 0 to 100%. Higher values cause a slower response, lower values cause a faster response. A value of zero disables the limit

param.name: TRQD_DIR_DELAY
param.documentation: Torqeedo direction change delay. Output will remain at zero for this many seconds when transitioning between forward and backwards rotation

param.name: VISO_TYPE
param.documentation: Visual odometry camera connection type

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera X position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera Y position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera Z position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

param.name: VISO_ORIENT
param.documentation: Visual odometery camera orientation

param.name: VISO_SCALE
param.documentation: Visual odometry scaling factor applied to position estimates from sensor

param.name: VISO_DELAY_MS
param.documentation: Visual odometry sensor delay relative to inertial measurements

param.name: VISO_VEL_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry velocity measurement noise in m/s

param.name: VISO_POS_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry position measurement noise minimum (meters). This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

param.name: VISO_YAW_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry yaw measurement noise minimum (radians), This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

param.humanName: Is the Video Transmitter enabled or not
param.name: VTX_ENABLE
param.documentation: Toggles the Video Transmitter on and off

param.name: VTX_POWER
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, the power level chosen will be rounded down to the nearest supported power level

param.name: VTX_CHANNEL
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Channel

param.name: VTX_BAND
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Band

param.name: VTX_FREQ
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Frequency. The frequency is derived from the setting of BAND and CHANNEL

param.name: VTX_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Options. Pitmode puts the VTX in a low power state. Unlocked enables certain restricted frequencies and power levels. Do not enable the Unlocked option unless you have appropriate permissions in your jurisdiction to transmit at high power levels.
param.field: 0:Pitmode,1:Pitmode until armed,2:Pitmode when disarmed,3:Unlocked,4:Add leading zero byte to requests

param.name: VTX_MAX_POWER
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Maximum Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, this prevents the power aux switch from requesting too high a power level. The switch supports 6 power levels and the selected power will be a subdivision between 0 and this setting.

param.name: WENC_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of WheelEncoder is connected

param.name: WENC_CPR
param.documentation: WheelEncoder counts per full revolution of the wheel

param.name: WENC_RADIUS
param.documentation: Wheel radius

param.name: WENC_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

param.name: WENC_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

param.name: WENC_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

param.name: WENC_PINA
param.documentation: Input Pin A

param.name: WENC_PINB
param.documentation: Input Pin B

param.name: WENC2_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of WheelEncoder sensor is connected

param.name: WENC2_CPR
param.documentation: WheelEncoder 2 counts per full revolution of the wheel

param.name: WENC2_RADIUS
param.documentation: Wheel2's radius

param.name: WENC2_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

param.name: WENC2_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

param.name: WENC2_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

param.name: WENC2_PINA
param.documentation: Second Encoder Input Pin A

param.name: WENC2_PINB
param.documentation: Second Encoder Input Pin B

param.name: WNDVN_TYPE
param.documentation: Wind Vane type

values.value: RC input offset heading when armed

param.humanName: Wind vane analog voltage pin for direction
param.name: WNDVN_DIR_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin to read as wind vane direction

param.name: WNDVN_DIR_V_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum voltage supplied by analog wind vane. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

param.name: WNDVN_DIR_V_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum voltage supplied by analog wind vane. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

param.name: WNDVN_DIR_OFS
param.documentation: Angle offset when analog windvane is indicating a headwind, ie 0 degress relative to vehicle

param.humanName: apparent Wind vane direction low pass filter frequency
param.name: WNDVN_DIR_FILT
param.documentation: apparent Wind vane direction low pass filter frequency, a value of -1 disables filter

param.name: WNDVN_CAL
param.documentation: Start wind vane calibration by setting this to 1 or 2

param.humanName: Wind vane deadzone when using analog sensor
param.name: WNDVN_DIR_DZ
param.documentation: Wind vane deadzone when using analog sensor

param.humanName: Wind vane cut off wind speed
param.name: WNDVN_SPEED_MIN
param.documentation: Wind vane direction will be ignored when apparent wind speeds are below this value (if wind speed sensor is present). If the apparent wind is consistently below this value the vane will not work

param.name: WNDVN_SPEED_TYPE
param.documentation: Wind speed sensor type

param.humanName: Wind vane speed sensor analog pin
param.name: WNDVN_SPEED_PIN
param.documentation: Wind speed analog speed input pin for Modern Devices Wind Sensor rev. p

param.humanName: Wind vane speed sensor analog temp pin
param.name: WNDVN_TEMP_PIN
param.documentation: Wind speed sensor analog temp input pin for Modern Devices Wind Sensor rev. p, set to -1 to diasble temp readings

param.humanName: Wind speed sensor analog voltage offset
param.name: WNDVN_SPEED_OFS
param.documentation: Wind sensor analog voltage offset at zero wind speed

param.humanName: apparent wind speed low pass filter frequency
param.name: WNDVN_SPEED_FILT
param.documentation: apparent Wind speed low pass filter frequency, a value of -1 disables filter

param.humanName: True speed and direction low pass filter frequency
param.name: WNDVN_TRUE_FILT
param.documentation: True speed and direction low pass filter frequency, a value of -1 disables filter

param.name: WP_SPEED
param.documentation: Waypoint speed default

param.name: WP_RADIUS
param.documentation: The distance in meters from a waypoint when we consider the waypoint has been reached. This determines when the vehicle will turn toward the next waypoint.

param.name: WP_OVERSHOOT
param.documentation: Waypoint overshoot maximum in meters. The vehicle will attempt to stay within this many meters of the track as it completes one waypoint and moves to the next.

param.name: WP_PIVOT_ANGLE
param.documentation: Pivot when the difference between the vehicle's heading and its target heading is more than this many degrees. Set to zero to disable pivot turns. Note: This parameter should be greater than 10 degrees for pivot turns to work.

param.name: WP_PIVOT_RATE
param.documentation: Turn rate during pivot turns

param.name: WP_SPEED_MIN
param.documentation: Vehicle will not slow below this speed for corners. Should be set to boat's plane speed. Does not apply to pivot turns.

param.name: WP_PIVOT_DELAY
param.documentation: Waiting time after pivot turn

param.name: WRC_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable or disable wheel rate control

param.name: WRC_RATE_MAX
param.documentation: Wheel max rotation rate

param.humanName: Wheel rate control feed forward gain
param.name: WRC_RATE_FF
param.documentation: Wheel rate control feed forward gain. Desired rate (in radians/sec) is multiplied by this constant and output to output (in the range -1 to +1)

param.name: WRC_RATE_P
param.documentation: Wheel rate control P gain. Converts rate error (in radians/sec) to output (in the range -1 to +1)

param.name: WRC_RATE_I
param.documentation: Wheel rate control I gain. Corrects long term error between the desired rate (in rad/s) and actual

param.humanName: Wheel rate control I gain maximum
param.name: WRC_RATE_IMAX
param.documentation: Wheel rate control I gain maximum. Constrains the output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

param.name: WRC_RATE_D
param.documentation: Wheel rate control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired rate vs actual

param.name: WRC_RATE_FILT
param.documentation: Wheel rate control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

param.humanName: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz
param.name: WRC_RATE_FLTT
param.documentation: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz
param.name: WRC_RATE_FLTE
param.documentation: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: WRC_RATE_FLTD
param.documentation: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: WRC_RATE_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.humanName: Wheel rate control feed forward gain
param.name: WRC2_RATE_FF
param.documentation: Wheel rate control feed forward gain. Desired rate (in radians/sec) is multiplied by this constant and output to output (in the range -1 to +1)

param.name: WRC2_RATE_P
param.documentation: Wheel rate control P gain. Converts rate error (in radians/sec) to output (in the range -1 to +1)

param.name: WRC2_RATE_I
param.documentation: Wheel rate control I gain. Corrects long term error between the desired rate (in rad/s) and actual

param.humanName: Wheel rate control I gain maximum
param.name: WRC2_RATE_IMAX
param.documentation: Wheel rate control I gain maximum. Constrains the output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

param.name: WRC2_RATE_D
param.documentation: Wheel rate control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired rate vs actual

param.name: WRC2_RATE_FILT
param.documentation: Wheel rate control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

param.humanName: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz
param.name: WRC2_RATE_FLTT
param.documentation: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz
param.name: WRC2_RATE_FLTE
param.documentation: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: WRC2_RATE_FLTD
param.documentation: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: WRC2_RATE_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.
